awd_titl_txt: Periodicity of Volcanism and Hydrothermal Activity on the   Gorda Ridge
awd_abstract_narration: The Gorda Ridge is part of the global system of mid-ocean               ridges along which new ocean floor is created. The southern third               of the ridge extends for a length of about 120 km off the                       northern California coast and is characterized by a deep axial                  valley covered by thick sediment fill. At least five volcanic                   centers rise above this sediment cover at an average spacing of                 15 km. These volcanoes provide a unique opportunity to study the                frequency of volcanic activity at mid-ocean ridges, since the                   products of this volcanism should be recorded in the accumulating               sediment.                                                                               The present project will use a set of previously collected              cores from this area to examine the episodicity of discrete                     volcanic events and the chemical evolution of discrete magmatic                 centers in the rift valley.
